alert.note: Alert for Henderson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 16 at 5:52AM CST until February 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM CST FOR NORTHWESTERN HENDERSON...SOUTHEASTERN GIBSON AND CARROLL COUNTIES... At 552 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Milan, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Milan, Huntingdon, Bruceton, Atwood, Medina, Hollow Rock, Clarksburg, McLemoresville, Howley, Hickory Flat, Hillard, Dollar, Ledbetter, Leach, Sitka, Tate, Palmer Shelter, Buena Vista, Westport and West. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
